intro: [WRONG START] Colderia glabra, commonly known as the smooth coldenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Coldenia glabra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
